乀字的基本解释

乀
fú
汉字笔画的一种，从左向右斜下，亦称“捺”。

乀字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fú］
［《廣韻》敷勿切，入物，敷。］
汉字笔画之一。通称“捺”。

乀字的康熙字典解释

【子集上】【丿字部】　乀； 康熙笔画：2； 页码：页81第07
【廣韻】敷勿切【集韻】分勿切，?音弗。【說文】左戾也，从反丿。　又【集韻】力詰切，音列。義同。◎按《字彙》丿右戾譌左，乀左戾譌右，?非。

乀字的源字形

字源演变：

楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
乀字的起名意思

暂无。

Yi
Basic explanation of words
Yi
fú
A type of Chinese character strokes, diagonally downward from left to right, also known as "捺".
Yi
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［fú］
["Guangyun" apply do not cut, into the object, apply. ]
One of the strokes of Chinese characters. Commonly known as "捺".
Yi
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【Subset Part I】【Feng Zi Department】　乀; Kangxi strokes: 2; Page number: page 81 to 07
[Guang Yun] Don’t cut it while applying [Jiyun] Don’t cut it separately. [Said the text] Zuo Hu also, from the anti-salary.　[Jiyun] Li Xieqie, phonetic series. The same meaning. ◎According to "Zihui", it is not right or right, or left or right, not right.
